column4: okay I'll try to sum up my problem again sorry but I really do need help, I checked wikis, google... and I've been on the same issue for hours now. I just want my laptop to boot up in a correct resolution "1024x768" instead of "1600x1200". Here's my xorg.conf http://pastebin.com/as3JvpMM and the interestings parts of xorg logs (lines 16 and 34 to 36 in particular). What am I doing wrong ? help me please
out of curiosity  which video card...    lspci | grep -i vga
: 01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: VIA Technologies, Inc. K8M800/K8N800/K8N800A [S3 UniChrome Pro] (rev 01)
ooo   unichrome.... ah I know very little about unichrome chips... or the drivers  hold on let me check
: once it has booted I have to do alt F2 then type "xrandr -s 1024x768" and then it's perfect... Im sure there's a way I can tell xorg.conf to do that automatically
well did you find a driver for that ?
: without xorg.conf everything works fine except I have to manually change the resolution at startup
mmm... I assume you saw this page?   https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OpenChrome
: can it be related to this weird (II) CHROME(0): ViaPanelGetNativeModeFromOption in xorg.log ? the link you gave is outdated...
yeah I know the link is outdated..unfortunately... I am going to assume that the driver needs to be installed properly.... at least in order to fix the resolution issue
: can it be not properly installed and works this good ? the only problem is the default autodetected resolution is wrong...
ok  I am going to suggest going to the ##linux channel...they have a braoder base of knowledge there and might be able to straighten this out for you
: I think the startup script with xrandr sounds an easier solution than compiling latest drivers and stuff for such a small issue ...
: I didn't send the link to my xorg logs properly : http://pastebin.com/u5J5JHJF can you tell me what you think of lines 16 and 34-36 ?
: im the only one talking in ##linux ... :(
